control.name: 3.6.3 - Secure cryptographic key storage
control.desc: The encryption solution must store keys securely, for example, by encrypting them with a key-encrypting key. Storing keys without proper protection could provide access to attackers, resulting in the decryption and exposure of cardholder data.

test.steps:
3.6.3.a Verify that key-management procedures specify how to securely store keys.

3.6.3.b Observe the method for storing keys to verify that keys are stored securely.
